inputFlag.name: ORIGINAL_RELIABLE
inputFlag.description: The data value is the original value retrieved from an external source and it successfully passes all validation criteria set

inputFlag.name: CORRECTED_RELIABLE
inputFlag.description: The original value was removed and corrected. Correction may be through byteerpolation or manual editing

outputFlag.name: EDITED
outputFlag.description: Data value has been edited; this may be a manual or automatic process

inputFlag.name: COMPLETED_RELIABLE
inputFlag.description: Original value was missing. Value has been filled in through byteerpolation, transformation (e.g. stage discharge) or a model

inputFlag.name: ORIGINAL_DOUBTFUL
inputFlag.description: Observed value retrieved from external data source. Value is valid, but marked as suspect due to soft validation limits being exceeded

inputFlag.name: CORRECTED_DOUBTFUL
inputFlag.description: The original value was removed and corrected. However, the corrected value is doubtful due to validation limits

inputFlag.name: COMPLETED_DOUBTFUL
inputFlag.description: Original value was missing. Value has been filled in as above, but resulting value is doubtful due to limits in transformation/byteerpolation or input value used for transformation being doubtful

inputFlag.name: ORIGINAL_UNRELIABLE
inputFlag.description: Observed value retrieved from external data source. Value is invalid due to validation limits set. Value is removed.

inputFlag.name: CORRECTED_UNRELIABLE
inputFlag.description: The original value was removed and corrected. However, corrected value is unreliable and is removed.

inputFlag.name: COMPLETED_UNRELIABLE
inputFlag.description: Original value was missing. Value has been filled in as above, but resulting value is unreliable and is removed.

inputFlag.name: ORIGINAL_MISSING
inputFlag.description: Missing value in originally observed series. Note this is a special form of both ORIGINAL/UNRELIABLE and ORIGINAL/RELIABLE.
